text: Lancaster is a city in Atchison County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 246 people lived there. == History == Lancaster was platted in 1857. It may have been named after Lancaster, Pennsylvania. Lancaster was an early contender for county seat. In 1915, Lancaster had seven stores, a school, three churches, a grain elevator, a lumber yard, and a hotel. Lancaster was a station on the Missouri Pacific Railroad. == Geography == Lancaster is at (39.571159, -95.303712). According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. == Demographics == === 2020 census === As of the 2020 census, there were 246 people, 109 households, and 73 families living in the city. Of the households, 83.5% owned their home and 16.5% rented their home. The median age was 43.6 years. Of the people, 96.3% were White and 3.7% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 1.6% of the people. === 2010 census === As of the 2010 census says that there were 298 people, 108 households, and 87 families living in the city. == References == == Other websites == ;City * Lancaster - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 377, local school district ;Maps * Lancaster City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Atchison County, Kansas Category:1857 establishments in Kansas Territory
title: Lancaster, Kansas
